clinical_study.brief_title: Investigation of the Clinical Safety and Efficacy of Long-term Treatment With Fycompa Tablets in Adult Epilepsy Patients With Partial-onset Seizures (With or Without Secondary Generalized Seizures) or Primary Generalized Tonic-clonic Seizures
clinical_study.official_title: Investigation of the Clinical Safety and Efficacy of Long-term Treatment With Fycompa Tablets in Adult Epilepsy Patients With Partial-onset Seizures (With or Without Secondary Generalized Seizures) or Primary Generalized Tonic-clonic Seizures

primary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with any serious adverse event
Number of participants with any non-serious adverse event

secondary_outcome.measure: Overall improvement rating in seizure frequency

clinical_study.condition: Partial Seizures (With or Without Secondary Generalized Seizures)

arm_group.description: Adult epilepsy participants with partial-onset seizures (with or without secondary generalized seizures) or primary generalized Tonic-clonic seizures who receive long-term treatment with Fycompa

intervention.description: The usual oral dosage for adults and children 12 years of age or older is initially 2 milligrams (mg) once daily as perampanel at bedtime, and the daily dose may then be increased by 2 mg at intervals of 1 week or longer. The maintenance dose is 8 mg once daily in the absence of concomitant antiepileptic drugs that accelerate the metabolism of this product, or 8 to 12 mg once daily in the presence of such concomitant drugs. The dosage may be increased or decreased as necessary by 2 mg at intervals of 1 week or longer depending on symptoms, but the maximum daily dose should not be over 12 mg.

study_pop.textblock: Participants with epilepsy who will receive Fycompa per the approved indication in routine clinical practice

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Epilepsy participants at least 18 years of age with:
- Partial seizures (with or without secondary generalized seizures)
- Primary generalized Tonic-clonic seizures
Exclusion Criteria:
- Participants previously treated with Fycompa
